poem:
The Longest Laughter

Where once the brittle laugh  
echoed in twilight's grace,  
now the ink-stained hand  
toils at its endless place.  
Characters rise and fall—  
ephemeral as breath—  
yet the flicker endures,  
illuminating death,  
the scope of humor's span  
in time's unyielding grip,  
where truth and folly blend,  
straining the artist's quip.
